title: Correlation Tables
text: styling options include: note custom markdown formatted note. Overrides automatic note bolded correlations significant. Default: NULL p_value Significance value. Default: .05 digits Number digits rounding. Default: 2 bold_significant Whether bold significant correlations. Default: TRUE significance_note Whether note bolding correlations appears. Overridden custom note. Also, automatic note appear correlations significant. Default: TRUE output Options flextable, gt tibble. Default: flextable family Font family (typeface). Default: Times New Roman font_size Font size (points). Default: 12 text_color Text color. Default: black border_color Table border color. Default: black border_width Table border width. Default: 0.5 line_spacing Text line spacing. Default: 2 example, remove summary statistics entirely, set summary_functions NULL. Variable 1 2 3 1. Girth —   2. Height .52 —  3. Volume .97 .60 —
code: # List of descriptive functions my_summaries <- list(M = mean,                      SD = sd,                      Skew = psych::skew,                      `Kurt.` = psych::kurtosi,                      n = function(x) sum(!is.na(x))) trees %>%    apa_cor(note = "*M* = Mean, *SD* = Standard Deviation, *Skew* =  Skewness, *Kurt.* =  Kurtosis",           p_value = .001,            digits = 2,           bold_significant = FALSE,            significance_note = FALSE,           summary_functions = my_summaries,           output = "gt",            family = "Arial",            font_size = 10,            text_color = "darkred",           border_color = "royalblue4",            border_width = 1,            line_spacing = 2) apa_cor(trees,          summary_functions = NULL,          bold_significant = FALSE)

title: Correlation Tables
text: styling options apa_cor minimal, flexable gt tables allow kinds customization. Just place whatever code flextable gt want apa_cor. example, gt tables usually span 100% width space. set width 50% align table left page. place footnote specific cell table body. flextable: Variable M SD 1 2 3 1. Girth 13.25 3.14 —   2. Height1 76.00 6.37 .52 —  3. Volume 30.17 16.44 .97 .60 — 1This footnote.
code: apa_cor(trees, output = "gt", significance_note = F) %>%    gt::tab_options(table.width = gt::pct(50),                    table.align = "left") %>%    gt::tab_footnote("This is a footnote.",                     locations = gt::cells_body(columns = "Variable",                                                rows = 2)) apa_cor(trees, significance_note = F) %>%   flextable::set_table_properties(align = "left") %>%   flextable::width(j = c("Variable", "M", "SD", "1", "2", "3"), width = c(1, .45, .45, .45, .45, .45)) %>%    flextable::footnote(     i = 2,     j = "Variable",     value = flextable::as_paragraph("This is a footnote."),     part = "body"   )

title: APA-formatted correlation table — apa_cor
text: APA-formatted correlation table

title: APA-formatted correlation table — apa_cor
code: apa_cor(   data,   note = NULL,   p_value = 0.05,   digits = 2,   bold_significant = TRUE,   significance_note = TRUE,   output = c("flextable", "gt", "tibble"),   family = "Times New Roman",   font_size = 12,   text_color = "black",   border_color = "black",   border_width = 0.5,   line_spacing = 2,   summary_functions = list(M = mean, SD = stats::sd),   ... )

title: APA-formatted correlation table — apa_cor
text: data data.frame tibble variables note Custom note appear table. (Overrides automatic note.) p_value p-value needed flagged significant digits Number digits rounding bold_significant bold significant correlations significance_note TRUE, place note bottom table significant correlations bolded. output output type. Can "flextable" "gt" "tibble" family font family font_size font size text_color text color border_color border color border_width border width pixels line_spacing spacing lines summary_functions named list functions summarize data columns (e.g., mean, sd) ... <data-masking> parameters passed psych::corTest

title: APA-formatted correlation table — apa_cor
text: flextable, gt, tibble

title: p-value in APA format — apa_p
code: # Values less than .001 are <.001 apa_p(.0002) #> [1] "*p* < .001" # Values between .001 and .01 are rounded to 3 digits apa_p(.002) #> [1] "*p* = .002" # Values between .01 and .995 are rounded to 2 digits apa_p(.02)#' #> [1] "*p* = .02" apa_p(.22) #> [1] "*p* = .22" apa_p(.994) #> [1] "*p* = .99" # Values above .995 are >.99 apa_p(.999) #> [1] "*p* = 1.00"

title: install the apaquarto extension from https://github.com/wjschne/apaquarto — install_apaquarto
install the apaquarto extension from https://github.com/wjschne/apaquarto — install_apaquarto
text: make_project importing apaquarto folder, make folder project.

title: install the apaquarto extension from https://github.com/wjschne/apaquarto — install_apaquarto
code: install_apaquarto #> function (make_project = TRUE)  #> { #>     rstudioapi::verifyAvailable() #>     path <- rstudioapi::selectDirectory(caption = "Select a directory (i.e., folder) , in which to install apaquarto.") #>     if (!is.null(path) && dir.exists(path)) { #>         old <- getwd() #>         setwd(path) #>         quarto::quarto_add_extension("wjschne/apaquarto", no_prompt = TRUE) #>         purrr::walk(c("template.qmd", "example.qmd", "apa.csl",  #>             "bibliography.bib", "sampleimage.png"), function(myfile) { #>             m <- ifelse(myfile == "sampleimage.png", "wb", "w") #>             utils::download.file(url = fs::path("https://raw.github.com/wjschne/apaquarto/main/",  #>                 myfile), destfile = fs::path(path, myfile), mode = m) #>         }) #>         if (make_project) { #>             if (length(dir(path, ".Rproj$")) > 0) { #>                 dirpath <- fs::path_split(path)[[1]] #>                 quarto::quarto_create_project(dirpath[length(dirpath)],  #>                   type = "default", dir = fs::path_dir(path)) #>             } #>             rstudioapi::openProject(path, newSession = TRUE) #>         } #>     } #> } #> <bytecode: 0x560f98cf75d8> #> <environment: namespace:apa7>
